H0.text: Gases and liquids become solids at low temperatures.

H1.text: At relative temperatures, gases and liquids become solids.

H2.text: At hot temperatures, gases and liquids become solids.

H3.text: At high temperatures, gases and liquids become solids.

A4.text: Deposition is a process where gas changes directly to solid without passing through liquid, releasing energy.

A5.text: For deposition to occur, thermal energy must be removed from a gas when the air becomes cold enough.
